Search Path Selection

Use the Search Path Selection dialog box to choose from the available search paths and to specify how targets are to be selected.

A search path is identified by a name such as DEVELOPMENT or TESTING. The name and definition of a search path occurs in the Merant Build web client.

Search paths are used to locate source files and build tools. If any of your builds occur on machines with operating systems different from your own, or on varying operating systems, you may need to select a different search path, because build tools vary with the operating system.

All of the search path information should be set up ahead of time by the Merant Build administrator. You simply select a search path. That search path becomes the second part of the default build job name. If you wish, you can enter a different name for the build job. (If you then save the job, it will be saved as a private build job.)

After you have filled out the fields on this dialog box, click Next to go to the Parameters dialog box (or the Target Selection dialog box if you selected "Build selected targets").

Field Descriptions

Merant Build project A read-only field displaying the name of the Merant Build project.
Search path name Choose from the named search paths set up ahead of time by the Merant Build Administrator.
Build job name Accept the default build job name, or enter a name of your own. The default build job name is composed of the project name followed by the search path name.
Build all targets Choose this to build all target files stored in the Version Manager project.
Build selected targets Choose this to build only selected targets. The Target Selection dialog box displays, allowing you to choose which targets to build.
